message:
Hartal for govt. injustice

Justice Obaidul Hassan-led International Crimes Tribunal-2 sentenced Jamaat's Acting Secretary General Rafiqul Islam Khan and central committee member Hamidur Rahman Azad MP to three months in jail and fined Tk 3,000 each on contempt charges by means of adverse comments on a sub-judice matter and failure to appear in court for hearing.
Dhaka Metropolitan unit Assistant Secretary Mohammad Selim Uddin was sentenced to a day in prison and fined Tk 1,000 on similar charges. He will have to serve another week in jail if he does not pay the fine.

The Jamaat’s acting chief alleged his party leaders had been 'deprived of justice'.

However, Sylhet, Rajshahi, Khulna, and Barisal metropolitans have been kept out of the strike's purview due to forthcoming city corporation polls.
